title: British Columbia storm: Cows rescued from storm floods by jet ski
description: People had to move cows to higher ground after devastating flooding in Canada's British Columbia.

title: Liverpool bomb: Flames beat me back, says explosion witness
description: Liam Spencer and Stephanie Stitt were yards away from the explosion outside Liverpool Women's Hospital.

title: Three Amigos summit: Awkward conversations for US with its neighbours
description: US, Canada and Mexico's leaders meet Thursday in Washington, with plenty of differences to resolve.

title: Red crabs swarm across roads and bridges in Australia
description: An annual migration of red crabs has covered roads and bridges on an Australian island.

title: Azeem Rafiq 'determined' sharing experiences of racism will be pivotal moment for sport and society
description: Azeem Rafiq says he is "determined" that sharing his experiences of racism at Yorkshire will be the moment "not only sport but society as a whole" moved in a different direction.

title: Covid: When can teenagers get a second dose?
description: All 16 and 17 year-olds in the UK can now have a second dose 12 weeks after the first.

title: Covid: What do we know about Randox and its contracts?
description: Sir Keir Starmer calls for an investigation into Randox and government contracts.

title: Queen seen in first engagement since Cenotaph absence
description: The 95-year-old monarch had missed the Remembrance Sunday service due to a sprained back.

title: Britain's Norrie to make ATP Finals debut after Tsitsipas pulls out
description: Great Britain's Cameron Norrie will make his debut at the ATP Finals after Stefanos Tsitsipas withdraws injured from the event in Turin.

title: Ottoman atlas found in Northamptonshire smashes auction estimate
description: The auction house says the 1804 Ottoman atlas was the first printed in the Islamic world.

title: Liverpool bomber had been planning attack since April
description: Emad Al Swealmeen rented a property in the city and began making purchases for his bomb, police say.

title: Inflation: UK prices soar at fastest rate for almost ten years
description: Inflation surges to 4.2% on rising fuel and energy costs, paving the way for an interest rate rise.

title: Liverpool bomb: Church of England 'not aware' of link between asylum abuse and conversion
description: The Liverpool bomber - a Christian convert - made failed attempts at asylum, the BBC has been told.

title: Azeem Rafiq: Former Yorkshire cricketer says it's 'important we don't let this moment go'
description: Speaking a day after he told MPs that English cricket is "institutionally" racist, Azeem Rafiq says "it's really important we don't let this moment go".

title: Overdue book returned 73 years late to Fife library
description: Stately Timber by Rupert Hughes should have been handed back to Dunfermline's Central Library in 1948.

title: Jordanne Whiley announces retirement from wheelchair tennis
description: Britain's 13-time Grand Slam champion Jordanne Whiley has announced her retirement from wheelchair tennis, saying she leaves with "no regrets and a heart filled with pride".

title: Amazon to stop accepting Visa credit cards in UK
description: The online giant says high Visa fees mean it won't process credit card transactions from 19 January.

title: Insulate Britain protesters jailed for defying road blockade ban
description: Insulate Britain admitted flouting a ban on protests on the M25 at the High Court.

title: Lorna Middleton jailed for 'revenge' husband murder
description: Lorna Middleton stabbed her husband in the heart after a row at their home in Clydebank.

title: Peak District photographer chuffed with 'man on the Moon' shot
description: The mystery subject is thanked for being "in the right place at the right time".

title: Channel 4 to find Scottish family for Gogglebox
description: A casting team is searching for a new family for the TV programme after complaints about a lack of Scots.

title: Decathlon halts canoe sales to curb English Channel migrant crossings
description: Decathlon's decision comes after a sharp rise in attempts to reach the UK from northern France.

title: Sophie Ellis-Bextor raises £1m in 24-hour Children In Need danceathon
description: The star says she's "going to go for a warm bath" after the Children In Need dance challenge.

title: Grandad who earned karate black belt at the age of 74
description: Grandad Mike Mitchell overcame embarrassment and competed at events full of children to earn his belt.

title: DaBaby: DaniLeigh charged with assaulting partner
description: Rapper DaBaby calls police after allegedly being assaulted by his girlfriend, US police say.

title: Osaka voices worry over China player Peng
description: Peng Shuai has not been heard from since she made sexual assault allegations against a Chinese official.

title: From dole to goal - how one-time unemployed outcast Mendy became a goalkeeping star at Chelsea
description: From an unknown quantity, Chelsea's Edouard Mendy has become one of the world's best goalkeepers, setting new standards behind the meanest defence in the Premier League

title: The students losing thousands in an Edinburgh rental scam
description: A BBC investigation uncovers a con that preys on the huge demand for rented accommodation in Edinburgh.

title: 'We're not battle-axes', say GP receptionists
description: Primary care staff in Bristol say they have never seen pressure like this before - and winter hasn't even started yet.

title: Frida Kahlo art fetches record $34.9m at auction
description: It is the most expensive piece by a Latin American, beating a record set by her husband Diego Rivera.

title: Panini: The sticker firm celebrating 60 years
description: How the football sticker maker survived a thieving tycoon and competition from Lycra-clad wrestlers.

title: Dyson Award winners: Glaucoma glove and bottle scanner
description: A device to stem blood loss from stab wounds, which won the UK award, also received an international prize.

title: Bulgarian election: Kiril Petkov, Assen Vassilev, a battle-bus and a brand new party
description: Two entrepreneurs heading an anti-corruption party look to form a government in Bulgaria.

title: Jai Bhim: The Indian film that overtook The Godfather on IMDb
description: Jai Bhim, a film on Dalit repression, is at the top of IMDb rankings in just two weeks since its release.

title: Climate change: What did the scientists make of COP26?
description: Scientists applaud some COP26 policies but fear measures don't go far enough and won’t be delivered.

title: COP26: The truth behind the new climate change denial
description: The claims that went viral in the lead-up to the COP climate summit – and what you need to know about them.

title: Life after deportation: 'Living the Mexican dream'
description: The experience of being sent back to Mexico can be a daunting one, though it can also have an upside.

title: Evil Corp: 'My hunt for the world's most wanted hackers'
description: The BBC’s Joe Tidy goes to Russia in search of men on the FBI’s cyber most wanted list.

title: All-party groups: The source of the next Westminster lobbying scandal?
description: Sleaze watchdog raises concerns as a BBC investigation finds £30m funnelled into Parliamentary groups.

title: Postpartum depression: A deaf mum's story.
description: Catherine, a single parent who is also deaf, struggled with postpartum depression.

title: Afghan judges in UK fear for colleagues left behind
description: The BBC has spoken to female judges who have just arrived in the UK as part of a rescue mission.
